title: Is there much of an IRL gaming scene on campus? (Fighting games, casual tournaments, etc.)
content:
Just curious — is there an actual gaming scene on campus where people meet up and throw hands (virtually, of course)? Like Street Fighter, Tekken, Smash, etc. Or is everyone just silently grinding ranked in their rooms?

Would be cool to know if there are any casual tournaments, clubs, or just folks who play together in person now and then. Not looking for esports-level sweatfests — just some good matches and fun banter.

Also, if there’s a Discord or WhatsApp group floating around, I’d love to hop in. 

Drop a reply or DM if you're into this too!

comments.body:
the only scene on campus are sleep deprived students. 

you will have many groups in the starting of the year for this game that game, by the second isa everything dissolves and people dont give a shit about gaming.

atleast gaming in groups during exam / assignment season.   
holidays everyone does everything and beyond

Damn never seen an Indian play fighting games especially tekken.
But the best way to find people to play games with is either get lucky and find friends on campus or ask in the discord server.
